questions.question: What is the chemical formula of the metal-organic framework material synthesized by diffusion of Ni(NO3)2·6H2O and 4,4‘-bipyridyl in methanol solution?
What experimental technique was used to collect single-crystal X-ray diffraction data for the synthesized metal-organic framework?
What is the maximum temperature up to which the synthesized metal-organic framework material is stable, as confirmed by thermogravimetric analyses?
How does the pore window size of the synthesized metal-organic framework compare to the minimum cross-sectional area of toluene?
questions.answer: The pore window size is smaller than the minimum cross-sectional area of toluene, but the framework can still admit toluene.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework undergoes a structural rearrangement when exposed to methanol vapor, transforming from structure B to structure A.
What is the role of methanol in the transformation of the related microporous material Ni2(4,4‘-bipyridine)3(NO3)4·2C2H5OH to Ni2(4,4‘-bipyridine)3(NO3)4?
questions.answer: Methanol vapor causes a guest-driven solid-state transformation from structure B to structure A.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework material can sorb oversized guests without significant change in its structure.
What is the estimated guest volume when the synthesized metal-organic framework material takes up ethanol?
True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework material loses its crystallinity after undergoing the solid-to-solid transformation from structure B to structure A.
What computational method was used to perform Monte Carlo docking calculations for the synthesized metal-organic framework?
questions.answer: MSI Insight II software using the combined valence force field (CVFF)

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework material is capable of undergoing a guest-driven solid-state transformation without the need for dissolution and recrystallization.
What is the significance of the observed flexibility in the synthesized metal-organic framework's pore windows?
questions.answer: The flexibility allows the material to sorb oversized guests like toluene by dynamically distorting the structure.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework material demonstrates a type I adsorption isotherm, indicating microporosity.
What is the effect of desolvation on the lattice parameters and cell volume of the synthesized metal-organic framework material?
questions.answer: Desolvation results in a 0.53(9)% reduction of the b lattice parameter and a reduction in the unit cell volume of 0.73(10)%.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework material retains its crystallinity and structure after sorption and desorption of ethanol over six cycles.
What is the role of hydrogen bonding in maintaining the structure of the synthesized metal-organic framework?
questions.answer: Hydrogen bonding confers stability on the crystal structure by connecting bipyridyl molecules in neighboring ladders.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework material can undergo a solid-state transformation directly from crystalline structure B to crystalline structure A without passing through an amorphous intermediate.
What experimental evidence supports the presence of toluene in the pores of the synthesized metal-organic framework material?
questions.answer: Postsorption gas chromatography provided independent evidence of the presence of toluene in the loaded sample.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesized metal-organic framework material demonstrates chemical stability in the presence of all guest species.
What distinguishes the porosity of the synthesized metal-organic framework material from that observed in zeolites?
questions.answer: Unlike zeolites, the synthesized material demonstrates flexibility allowing for the sorption of guests larger than the crystallographically determined pore windows.
